title: Polynomial Functions and Operations

vocab.definition: An expression consisting of variables and coefficients with non-negative integer exponents
The highest power of the variable in a polynomial
The coefficient of the term with the highest degree
How a function behaves as x approaches positive or negative infinity

teachingNotes: Use graphing technology to explore polynomial behavior. Connect to real-world modeling situations. Emphasize relationship between degree and graph shape.

sample.question: What is the degree and leading coefficient of f(x) = -3x⁴ + 2x² - 7x + 1?

truefalse.question: A polynomial of degree n can have at most n real zeros.
expectedAny: fundamental theorem of algebra limits number of zeros

multiplechoice.question: What is the end behavior of f(x) = -2x³ + 5x - 1?
expectedAny: negative leading coefficient with odd degree

fillintheblank.question: When multiplying (x + 3)(x² - 2x + 4), the degree of the resulting polynomial is _____.

shortanswer.question: Explain how the leading coefficient affects the end behavior of a polynomial function.
expectedAny: determines if ends go up or down
positive leads to up for even degree, negative leads to down

wordProblems.question: A company's profit function is P(x) = -0.5x³ + 12x² - 50x + 200, where x is thousands of units sold. What is the maximum degree of this profit function, and what does this suggest about long-term behavior?
expectedAny: degree 3, negative leading coefficient means profit eventually decreases
